amendment.description: Amendment adds $50 million (by offset) to the Domestic Nuclear Detection Office with $40 million intended for the Securing the Cities initiative and $10 million intended for the procurement of radiation portal monitors.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 8 printed in Part B of House Report 111-183 to add $50 million in funding to the Domestic Nuclear Detection Office, with $40 million intended for the Securing the Cities initiative and $10 million intended for the procurement of radiation portal monitors, offset by a reduction in the Department's Office of the Secretary and Executive Management and the Office of the Under Secretary for Management.

vote.text: On agreeing to the King (NY) amendment (A003) Agreed to by recorded vote: 282 - 148 (Roll no. 437).
